review_text:
A Perfect Getaway
When we first was suggested this house on Airbnb, it seemed almost too good to be true. There must be a catch! But everything was as perfect as it seemed online. My host, Rose, is the most thoughtful and gracious host weâ€™ve ever encountered.
The house itself is a gem. The kitchen is compact and contains everything one needs. The beds are comfortable, the bathroom is pristine, and the front porch is a relaxing getaway. I explored the area based on Roses excellent restaurant recommendations and had an amazing meal at the chop house down town Cheyenne.
But what truly sets this experience apart is Rose's hospitality. She went above and beyond to make my long weekend comfortable and relaxing. From providing local tips to ensuring our stay was seamless, she wad an exceptional hosts.
Thank you, Rose and Cheyenne, for a wonderful weekend! I'll definitely be back.
Warm regards, Rick

review_text: First when we got there we passed the place a couple of times because we couldn't believe this beautiful place was where we were staying. It was decorated so lovely we just thought we were in the wrong place. Then walking into the door, just took our breath away. We arrived late and we just kept looking around the place to take it all in. When we finally got to bed we were so in love with the bed and the bed linens we just felt like we were sleeping on a cloud. We have our own AirBnB that we rent out and my Husband who isn't a man of many words or opinions kept telling me, take a picture so we can try to do this in ours... he said that 3-4 times! That says a lot. We came in with my in-laws and my Mother to celebrate my Niece graduating from Nursing school and the house was so accommodating to all of us and we felt spoiled the whole visit. If we ever find our selves in Wyoming again we will for sure be back to stay at MAMA's house! Thank you for everything.

name: Charles
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
July 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
5 Star Cheyenne House
Accommodations
The house was big enough to accommodate 6 people, yet felt cozy at the same time. There was room for everyone to have their own place. Yet we still gathered at the downstairs tv area.
The house was well decorated with newer furniture. Most importantly, the place was clean. We have been to quite a few BnB rentals where we wanted nothing to do with the kitchen area.
Location
We felt that we were never more than a quick car ride to the sites, scenes and places to eat in Cheyenne.
The train museum, the Capitol Building, Cheyenne Frontier Days and plenty of place to eat where all nearby.
Hosts
There is no doubt that we would stay again with Rose and her family as hosts. They responded right away to our questions and requests.
Need extra toilet paper because you have four kids? Rose has it delivered to your door.
Need a recommendation on where to visit or a place to eat? Rose lets you know where to go.
Have a problem? Any problem? Rose and her family will speak with you directly over the phone, no matter what time of day, to make sure you are taken care of. It is comforting to know that you can actually speak with someone over the phone, and not have to text, email or use an app.
This was our first time visiting Wyoming. Rose and her family made our stay enjoyable thay we are already thinking about returning next year.
If you want updated decor, a clean house, close to everything and great hosts, this is the place to stay.

,
Â·
Group trip
review_text: This is your Airbnb for sure if you are in Cheyenne. The hosts has gone way above what most Airbnbs offer. This is probably in our top 3 that we've stayed in over the years. The decor is spot on & lovely. But the kitchen was very well stocked, entire place was clean and the washer/dryer were very helpful in our stay. They responded to our messages quickly & it's located in a nice place. We met my brother here in March 2022 and there were 5 of us. The upstairs area is delightful to just hang out & visit, no tv. But the family room downstairs is nice & the smart tv is stellar! The Master suite is delightful & pretty dark for late sleeping if that is your thing. We didn't get to use the wet bar or that area of I loved the concept & would come back for a nice getaway for a couples weekend. Don't hesitate, book it! One minor thing and it's more about our own tastes and the bar stools to the table aren't very comfortable to sit on when having a full meal. They sit alot higher than the table. But we ate only 2 meals here and there were 5 adults so just giving a heads up. Not a deal breaker for us just something to note.

They truly thought of an incredible layout for guests to experience the most comfortable stay - the king suite with a mini coffee kitchen and tv area was fantastic! We loved gathering in the open kitchen to living area with no tv distraction for catching up and chatting over food and drinks. The front and back yards were spacious and welcoming. I want to have a shower exactly like the downstairs bath in my home! From the design touches to how fluffy and soft the towels are, this is one of the top airbnb's we have stayed in and so glad that it is in Cheyenne. Rose is quick to respond and is so sweet over the phone. We enjoyed every moment of our stay and highly recommend booking this spot. Thank you so much, Rose!

Please take care of this home as you will want to stay here every time you are in the area. Plan to stay several days (we stayed a week). The Ramirez family is so compassionate and generous which made our reunion with our granddaughter and the death of her daddy easier to deal with. We will be back and hope we can stay again.

review_text: Josh & Halei's place was perfect for me this trip. It's decorated with a bit of quirkiness so it's unique & fun. It's a great size for 1 or 2 adults, but could handle more in a pinch. It does not have a/c which I usually look for, but opening the windows was fine for this trip. I might not book it in the very hottest months. It's in a great location, turn the corner & you see one of Cheyenne's prettier parks and the lake. It's not very far from downtown or other amenities. From living nearby in the past, I also know it's a safe area. Parking was conveniently always available right out front of the unit. There are several units so keep in mind you'll hear the neighbors some but I didn't hear them very often. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying here!

review_text: Stayed at Carolyn's bungalow while exploring Cheynne to see if I might move there permanently. The bungalow was spotless and comfortable; and stylish without a lot of decorative clutter. As a bigger person I appreciated the sturdier furniture such as the couch and dining chairs. The bed in the front bedroom was extremely comfortable and the linens were soft and cozy. The house is smaller but is laid out well and felt spacious. The neighborhood is quiet and I didn't notice a lot of 'city' noise. Carolyn provided everything I needed; and little extras like water, snacks, and fresh, baked cookies upon arrival. There are even toys and backup pet items available for families traveling with pets. The house is in a great location and easy to find. It's close to attractions and restaurants. The State Capital, museum, train depot, and historical districts, and even the hospital are just blocks away. Great location, great house, great host. I would highly recommend this little bungalow.

We were so comfortable, the house was equipped with everything we needed and more. Our only regret was that we were only in town for a single night, so we were unable to enjoy the area.
We appreciate being able to travel with our pups. The yard was secure and very well maintained. They were never left alone in the yard, but I didn't fear that there was trash, glass etc for them to encounter. The extra amenities for the dogs is a very sweet touch.
Carolyn was very responsive during our short stay. We woke up to terrible weather, interstate restrictions and closures. She was very kind to allow a later check out so the weather could pass and the roads could clear.
If given the opportunity to return to the Cheyenne area we'd definitely book Carolyn's home again.

While on a cross country road trip we found this Airbnb last minute in Cheyenne, for our family of 4 with two young children to stay for the night.
This Airbnb was PERFECTION. Beautifully decorated, incredibly clean, well stocked with all the comforts of home. She even had fresh cookies waiting for us. The bathroom was so inviting and clean, everyone made sure to take advantage of the shower and bath. This was HUGE for my little kids.
We have stayed in many airbnbs over the past ten years and this one may have been the very best in terms of cleanliness, decor, and hospitality. Thanks so much.

The room and kitchen were well stocked and spotless. I think the sink is even original, which was really cool! There is a little bit of wear and tear, which is to be expected. I think it added well to the overall feel and ambiance of the room/building. Parking was very close, which I really appreciate. It is right in downtown, so everything is really accessible. The instructions were clear, and the hosts were very responsive and helpful when I had questions. I was very comfortable, and I loved the stay!

This Airbnb was very nice considering that it was an old apartment building back in the early days. Bed was very comfortable. The water was nice and hot. The price was great. The place is very historic.
The only thing I didnâ€™t like about the place was getting into the building. You have to unlock a lockbox thatâ€™s hanging on the door to take out a key fob to put next to a keypad sensor to open the door. Put the keyfob back in the lockbox and scramble the combination. I donâ€™t see why you canâ€™t just use the keypad to open the door. That is a safety concern to me. Also the parking lot could use some lights. The lights on the building didnâ€™t work either. Need to see so you can unlock the lockbox at nightğŸ™„â€¦.another safety concern. Iâ€™m sure Iâ€™m not the first person that have these concerns. name: Ethan
rating_info:
Rating, 1 star
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This place is insanely loud.
The road from the interstate crosses over a huge train yard on a bridge. at the bottom of this bridge there is a stoplight. Above this stoplight is this unit.
I won't go so far as to say tat every vehicle in Cheyenne is either a giant pickup or a motorcycle with huge pipes, but I will say that there is never a time in this apartment that there isn't a vehicle with an oversized exhaust either driving by or idling at the stoplight, often with musical accompaniment (at loud enough volume to be heard over the exhaust).
This unit's location and paltry windows were not even coming close to providing a quiet enough place to sleep. Even backed up by earplugs, there was simply no way I was going to be able to sleep here.
Also, be concerned if you think you might want to do any two of: run the A/C, use the microwave, use the toaster, use a hair dryer. Evidently the entire unit is on on 20-amp circuit.
Consider yourselves warned.

name: Phil
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
Â·
June 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I stayed in apartment 32 so many of my comments pertain to that apartment only. Also I realize that when a person becomes negative, when they start to complain, that a lot of nit-picks can be brought up
I stayed in apartment 32 for 3 nights in mid June 2022.
Host used words like "fabulous character", "classic vibe" and "old" to describe the Murray Building. It most definintely is OLD, and looks OLD inside the apartment.
The wiring is old fashion 2-wire; there is no ground wire. An adapter is needed for all three-prong electrical cords from tenant appliances and power supplies. There is one extension cord with adapter available in the kitchen closet. Placement of outlets is inconvenient.
The tub-shower has awkward faucet placement, making it dangerous for elderly or infirm folk to set the water temperature and climb in.
There is an always-open window near the bed. The AC/heater exhaust exits the left side of the window and is sealed off. There is no pane in the right-side window, a crank only.
There is a lock-box on the first floor entry door that must be accessed every time a tenant comes in. This is very inconvenient. It gives one pause before going back to one's car/truck to retrieve a forgotten item. (I guess it's necessary though for security/safety sake. When I arrived there was a vagrant leaning against the wall in the parking lot alley. As I was making one of my trips to the truck to retrieve luggage, he asked for money. The next day there was an apparent drug deal taking place among several loiterers across the street.)
Apartment 32 is on the street-side of the building. There was lots of traffic noise late into the night and in the early morning. (Made worse by the pane-less window.) There was also a construction project underway but noise was minimal.
There is a hole 'to nowhere' under the kitchen sink. Used to be for a drain pipe I think. It should be sealed off.
Cosmetics: There is a crack in the bathroom sink. The enamel is peeling in the tub and kitchen sink.
I realize that Cheyenne is a high-rent area, however the cost of the apartment where I stayed was not worth the expense. If I get back to Cheyenne I shall look for alternatives.

review_text: We loved everything about staying at the ranch. Everything was great! The sheets and bed were very comfy! The house is huge and the room we staying in downstairs had its own private entrance. We had access to the kitchen to cook whenever we needed and there was a separate shared fridge downstairs to keep cold items. The land has great views and is close to some great hiking at Medicine Bow-Routt National Forest and Vedauwoo Road. If you need to go into town it's only about 20 mins to Cheyanne or 30 mins to Laramie. We felt very comfortable and welcome in the house and had everything we needed. Communication was great and was always available. This is a great value! Highly recommended and I hope to be back in the future!

review_text: Quality place to stay. Ranch sits hidden close to major highway so you have great access, yet that feeling of seclusion. The rooms compete with upscale hotels in decor and amenities. Deborah is a welcoming host, both attentive to your needs-- she puts out breakfast in the morning-- and respectful of your privacy. The place is family friendly, lots of room for children in this setting and great things for them to experience and see. My room was so comfortable with a big lounge chair and storage space for longer stays. Check out the Lazy Heart Ranch.

review_text: This Airbnb was recently remodeled within the last year or two. It has a security system and cameras hooked up to an indoor security system as well as his high-tech air conditioning. GPS has a difficult time finding the home. Upon arrival, there was a noticeable odor of what we think was smoke/mildew. We addressed this odor with the Airbnb host upon arrival and she said she was aware of the odor and they tried to cover it up with new paint. The listing states that it has Netflix, Hulu and other TV subscriptions but you have to use your own sign in. We notified the Airbnb host before arrival that we have a service dog but shortly after check out we received a message on Airbnb complaining about dog hair and that she wasnâ€™t notified about the dog. Overall, the host was a good communicator during our stay, parking was easy, and the host was accommodating with a flexible check out which we were grateful.

I admit, after a long day of travel , I usually depend on the host to give me a brief tutorial via email and he only gave me the door code which I thought was all I needed to know honestly . I didnâ€™t realize there was an alarm set and didnâ€™t know I had to park on the street so thatâ€™s my bad but the very cold demeanor in how he communicated this â€œ YOU REALLY SHOULD READ THE INSTRUCTIONS â€œ was not needed and made me afraid to even come out of the room the entire night . This was the first time a host has been like that to me and just felt he couldâ€™ve showed a little more grace. Hopefully he learns that but I would stay again for the price you pay .

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: We appreciate our stay at Mark's place. Very easily accessed from the thoroughfares (I-80 and I-25) , easy to find in the neighborhood, and entry was straightforward. Point of concern, hopefully not regular: upon arrival we did have to walk across about 30 of (not freshly fallen) snow-packed and slick walkway and driveway before reaching the 10 feet or so of cleared sidewalk up near the door. That said -- once inside, the very comfortable room and private bath is immediately inside the entry, on ground level, which was particularly appreciated. The space was very clean, attractive and amenities were great, except for the notable absence of bottled or otherwise filtered water. This was our first AirBnB stay where bottled water was not offered, and we hope the host will consider offering that to guests. Mark did indicate the municipal water was safe to drink -- but it is typical "city water", strongly treated, thus not pleasant for drinking. Overall, a pleasant stay. Thank you, Mark.
